medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
title: Taira Kiyomori Seeing Skulls in the Snowy Garden
marks:
Signature, Marks, and Inscriptions

URQ of R pan {Oju Yoshitoshi ga}
description: three piece folded image: older man with stubble stands on a balcony, looking out into garden with PR hand in a fist and clutching sheathed sword in PL hand; snow-covered rocks and hills in garden resemble menacing skulls with teeth staring back at man in the black night; right panel shows two terrified courtesans huddling with backs together in bed, windblown red and yellow shade, and a lamp; cartouche at URQ
creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund; purchase from the collection of Elizabeth and Willard Clark
